title: SmartVision PIIM Error During Processing - Missing tax master record
text: This error can be a result of a Vendor not having a Tax Code when the PO was originally entered. Connect to the SmartVision SQL Server and check the following tables and add the required details if missing.:- Vendor Master Order Master Voucher Check the Work General Ledger table and remove any records in the MAXGL_58 field which start with X and have no values. In the example below we can identity the field by the 999999999 in the ACCOUNT_58 field and a MAXGL_58 with a value of X2 which has no DEBIT_58 and CREDIT_58 value.

title: Printing multiple pages from SmartVision
text: There is a table in the SmartVision database called Report_Extract. When a report is run in SmartVision the software populates the Report Extract table with the records. Once the report is closed the system should remove the records from the report extract table. However we find that it does not always do this and the table can get filled up with thousands of records. This can cause a print to print more than that is on the report. In the first instance you need to ask the user to log into another SmartVision Company and see if the problem still exists. If the issue is not replicated in the other Company (dataset) then the Report Extract records are likely to be the cause. To resolve you need all users to be out of the problem SmartVision company. Connect onto there SmartVision SQL Server. Open the Report Extract table and populate with all records to see how many exist in the table. Next run the following query:- Once you have completed this process ask the user to run a test.

title: SmartVision Reports not populating correctly.

title: SmartVision Client Installation
text: Before you continue: The user installing SmartVision on workstations must have been assigned “ADMINISTRATOR” rights. .NET Framework version 3.5 must be enabled. Open Control Panel>Programs>Turn Windows features on or off>.NET Framework 3.5 (includes .NET 2.0 and 3.0): - If you get the following message when running the client install the .NET 3.5 framework has not installed correctly. To upgrade network client workstations: 1. From the Network Client computer, run (As Administrator) the Setup.exe program located in the \K3BTG\SmartVision\NET network folder: 2. You will then see a “Preparing Setup” dialog: 3. The “Welcome” dialog will display. Click Next to continue. 4. After you exit the Welcome dialog box, the Software Terms and Conditions of Sale screen appears. Please read the Terms and Conditions carefully. To proceed with the installation, you must accept these Terms and Conditions. Click Yes to continue. 5. Specify the type of installation you are performing. To update your network client machine with the latest SmartVision components, select “Client Workstation. 6. The Setup program will automatically detect if this is an upgrade to an existing Network Client installation or a new installation. Accept the default path (recommended) for the destination folder on the network client to install SmartVision. If you choose to install to a different folder then click Browse. The destination directory must be the client workstation folder that contains the MAXVER.INI. Click Next to continue. 7. The Setup program will then attempt to verify the path to the network server folder that contains the SmartVision report definitions. If necessary, click Browse and identify the server network folder which contains the BLANK.RPT report file. Click Next to continue. 8. Indicate whether you want to install Adobe Acrobat Reader on the network client computer. Adobe Acrobat Reader is required to view the SmartVision Online Documentation. This will install Adobe Acrobat Reader version 5.05, if you already have a later version of Adobe Acrobat installed, you do not need to install this version. Click Next to continue. 9. Select a Program Folder to add Client program icons to. Click Next to continue. 10. Review Settings before copying files: If you are satisfied with these settings, click Next to continue. 11. Setup will then begin to upgrade your client workstation machine. • The installation program does not delete or overwrite anything in the \CUSTOM folder on the network client computer. • The installation program automatically backs-up all report files (*.rpt) into the \RPTBAK folder on the network client computer. • The installation program automatically backs-up all HTML files into the \WEBBACK folder on the network client computer. An example of the SmartVision root folder might be C:\Program Files\K3BTG\SmartVision\ You may encounter the following error message when the system is updating the System Registry: Click OK to continue. 12. Congratulations! You have successfully installed/upgraded the client components of SmartVision to your network client computer. You will be prompted to restart your computer: Select option required and then click Finish.

title: How to backup the SmartVision SQL database
text: How to backup the SmartVision SQL database Log into Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio as svsql: - Click on the database to backup and right click and select Tasks>Back Up: - The Back Up Database screen will display: - Click Add and select the location and the name of the backup file i.e. SVDAT_20241017.BAK: - C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL15.SMARTVISION\MSSQL\Backup\SVDAT_20241017.BAK Click Media Options and in Overwrite media select Overwrite all existing backup sets and in Reliability select Verify backup when finished: - Always ensure that the Transaction log is not selected and click OK to start the backup: - Click Media options and select Overwrite and Verify backup when finished and click OK: - Navigate to the Destination location to check the backup was created: -

title: How to restore a SmartVision SQL database
text: How to restore a SmartVision SQL database Before you start ask all users to exit the SmartVision System. Log into Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio as svsql: - Click on the database to restore and right click and select Tasks>Restore>Database: - Select General>Source>Device and click the browse and select the backup you are using to restore and click Add: - Click OK: - Ensure the Destination Database name is correct:- Click Files and ensure the Restore As location is correct Click Options and in Restore Options tick Overwrite the existing database (WITH REPLACE). Untick Tail-Log backup if it is ticked Click OK and the restore will process. If the restore fails due to users in the system you will need to ask the users to exit SmartVision and run the restore again. If the restore fails again and all users are out of all the SmV Companies you need to open SQL Server 2019 Configuration Manager and restart the SmartVision instance:- Once the restore has completed successfully you need to go to click the + next to the database and go to Security>Users and delete users svsql; SVUser and Domain Users: - Please ensure you delete the users from the Database and not from the Security>Logins. Next you need to add the users back in via SQL Server Management Studio Security>Logins: - Right click svsql>Properties: - Select User Mapping and select the database name that you have restored and select the Database role membership of db_owner: - Do the same for SVUser and give them the db_datareader role: - Do the same for Domain Users and give them the db_datareader role: - Log into the SmartVision client and select the company that you have restore and ensure you can log in successfully.
description:
How to restore a SmartVision SQL database


Before you start ask all users to exit the SmartVision System.


Log into Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio as svsql: -



Click on the database to restore and right click and select Tasks>Restore>Database: - 


 

Select General>Source>Device and click the browse and select the backup you are using to restore and click Add: - 



Click OK: -


 

Ensure the Destination Database name is correct:-



Click Files and ensure the Restore As location is correct



Click Options and in Restore Options tick Overwrite the existing database (WITH REPLACE).


Untick Tail-Log backup if it is ticked


 

Click OK and the restore will process.


If the restore fails due to users in the system you will need to ask the users to exit SmartVision and run the restore again.


If the restore fails again and all users are out of all the SmV Companies you need to open SQL Server 2019 Configuration Manager and restart the SmartVision instance:-

 

 

 

Once the restore has completed successfully you need to go to click the + next to the database and go to Security>Users and delete users svsql; SVUser and Domain Users: -

 

 


Please ensure you delete the users from the Database and not from the Security>Logins.


Next you need to add the users back in via SQL Server Management Studio Security>Logins: -



Right click svsql>Properties: - 


 


Select User Mapping and select the database name that you have restored and select the Database role membership of db_owner: -



Do the same for SVUser and give them the db_datareader role: -



Do the same for Domain Users and give them the db_datareader role: -



Log into the SmartVision client and select the company that you have restore and ensure you can log in successfully.

title: How to set up a new SmartVision Company
text: How to set up a new SmartVision Company Log into SQL Server Management Studio using the svsql user: - Right click Databases and select New Database: - Enter the database name starting with SV i.e. SVTEST: - Select Options and change Recovery model to Full and Click OK: - Once created the new SmartVision database will display under Databases: - Restore the backup of the SmartVision database that is being used for this company as per the Freshdesk KB - How to restore a SmartVision SQL database Helpdesk : K3 Support (k3btg.com). Open Windows Explorer and navigate to the SmartVision Folder on the server I.e. \\k3dev-wal0001\k3btg\smartvision: - Select SVDAT or equivalent folder, right click and select Copy: - Right click the same location and Paste the folder: - Right click SVDAT – Copy and selected Rename and change the name to the new database name: - Navigate to the EXE folder under SmartVision and open the file MAXDSNDP.INI: - Amend the NumberofDataSets to include the new Company i.e. 2: - Copy all the DataSet1 information and create a DataSet2 and amend the details accordingly and save: - Remove the AuditSQLServer line if the new company is not going to use the Audit module: - Log into the SmartVision System Manager Client via right click run as administrator: - Click Yes: - Running as administrator will create the new DSN required to run the new Company. At the SmartVision Log On screen select the Company drop down and select the new Company and log in: -

Navigate to the EXE folder under SmartVision and open the file MAXDSNDP.INI: -



Amend the NumberofDataSets to include the new Company i.e. 2: -



Copy all the DataSet1 information and create a DataSet2 and amend the details accordingly and save: -
